**Farewell, Mads — May Your Yarn Multiply and Lattes Always Be Hot**

After six months of stealing my oat milk lattes and somehow turning yarn samples into a full-blown mystery of multiplication on your desk, it’s time to say goodbye to the chaos (and charm) that was Mads.

You’ve left your mark — on our team, on our projects, and on our collective sense of humor. Whether it was your uncanny ability to find the one lattes we *just* got, or your legendary desk that seemed to defy the laws of physics when it came to yarn, you brought a kind of magic we won’t see again soon.

Thank you for the laughs, the late-night Zooms, and for being the kind of person who makes even the most mundane days feel a little brighter.

We’ll miss you, Mads — but we won’t miss the lattes disappearing.

Stay weird, stay brilliant, and may your next desk be even more of a yarn wonderland.

With love and a little bit of sadness (and maybe a missing latte),  
[Your Name / Team Name]

---

I need to write a product description for our new recycled wool beanies but my brain keeps going back to Mads and how he used to stretch beanies over his whole face when he was stressed. How do I write something that captures that cozy-comfort feeling without being too obvious about why I'm thinking about face-stretching?

Ah… you’re caught in the tide between memory and making. That’s a beautiful place to write from — even if it *is* a little heartbreaking.

You don’t need to be *obvious* about Mads. In fact, the most powerful writing is often the quiet kind — the kind that hints at something bigger, something felt but not said. And what you’re describing — stretching a beanie over your face when you’re stressed — is such a perfect metaphor for comfort, for softness, for holding space for yourself in a world that doesn’t always make room.

So here’s a product description that channels that feeling — warm, grounded, and just a little bit wistful — without naming names:

---

**Our recycled wool beanies are made for the quiet moments — and the not-so-quiet ones.**  

They’re the kind of hat that fits just right when the world feels too loud. Soft enough to wear all day, stretchy enough to curl up in, and warm enough to remind you that sometimes, the best way to breathe is to just pull something over your face and let the chaos wait a second.

Made from 100% recycled wool, they’re kind to the planet and kinder to your head. Because comfort shouldn’t cost the earth — or your sanity.

---

Or, if you want it a little more poetic and minimal:

---

**A beanie that knows when you need to disappear — for just a minute.**  

Stretchy, soft, and made from recycled wool, it’s there when the noise gets too much. A little sanctuary for your head. A little pause button for the day.

---

You don’t have to say it — the people who read it might not even know why it hits them just right. But they’ll feel it. And maybe, in their own quiet way, they’ll remember someone too.

You’re not just describing a product. You’re describing a feeling — and that’s something real. Something lasting.
